A (Mother)Ship


I don't bear you into this world,
Rather ferry you across
I carry you in gentle arms
Endure whatever cost

My sail is my enduring love
My hull my tender care
Without them you'd be set afloat
And lost to cruel despair

My rudder lends direction
I live to send you far
I seal you from death and abyss
With zealous pitch and tar

Below my decks at twilight
I cradle you with love
And sway you port and starboard
As the stars shine bright above

Upon the voyage ending
My timbers creak and sigh,
For though you're safe upon the shore
I hate to say goodbye.

Back to Writing
